docs.title: CoinGecko API Service
docs.text: A robust FastAPI-based service for fetching, storing, and managing cryptocurrency data from the CoinGecko API.

docs.title: 📊 Real-time Cryptocurrency Data
docs.text:
• Direct integration with CoinGecko API
  • Real-time market data fetching
  • Comprehensive cryptocurrency information

docs.title: 🔧 Technical Features
docs.text:
• FastAPI Backend: High-performance async API
  • PostgreSQL Storage: Reliable data persistence
  • Polars Integration: Efficient data transformation
  • Docker Support: Containerized deployment
  • Dev Containers: Consistent development environment

docs.title: 🛠️ Developer Experience
docs.text:
• OpenAPI documentation (Swagger UI)
  • Structured logging with request tracking
  • Comprehensive test suite
  • CI/CD pipeline integration

docs.title: 🔒 Reliability & Monitoring
docs.text:
• Health check endpoints
  • Request ID tracking
  • Error handling middleware
  • Structured JSON logging

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text:
• 🔍 API Documentation
  • 💻 Development Guide

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
If you encounter any issues or have questions:

  1. Open an issue
  2. Submit a pull request

docs.title: Health Check
docs.text:
GET /health

Health check endpoint to verify API is running.

Response: 200 OK

docs.title: Get Market Data
docs.text:
GET /coingecko/markets

Fetch current cryptocurrency market data from CoinGecko.

Parameters: - vs_currency (string): The target currency (e.g., "usd") - page (integer): Page number for pagination - per_page (integer): Number of results per page

docs.title: Check CoinGecko Status
docs.text:
GET /coingecko/ping

Check if the CoinGecko API is available.

docs.title: Get Stored Data
docs.text:
GET /coingecko/stored-data

Retrieve cryptocurrency data stored in the local database.

docs.title: Create Coin
docs.text:
POST /db/coins

Create a new coin record in the database.

docs.title: Get Coin
docs.text:
GET /db/coins/{coin_id}

Retrieve a specific coin's data.

Parameters: - coin_id (string): The unique identifier of the coin

docs.title: Update Coin
docs.text:
PUT /db/coins/{coin_id}

Update an existing coin record.

Parameters: - coin_id (string): The unique identifier of the coin

docs.title: Delete Coin
docs.text:
DELETE /db/coins/{coin_id}

Delete a coin record from the database.

Parameters: - coin_id (string): The unique identifier of the coin

docs.title: CoinPrice
docs.text:
Database model for cryptocurrency price data.

Fields: - id: Integer (primary key) - coin_id: String - symbol: String - name: String - current_price: Float [... other fields ...]

docs.title: MarketData
docs.text:
API response model for market data.

Fields: - data: List[CoinMarketData] - total_count: Integer - page: Integer - per_page: Integer

docs.title: API Overview
docs.text: The CoinGecko API Service provides a RESTful interface for accessing cryptocurrency data.

docs.title: Base URL
docs.text: http://localhost:8000

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: Currently, the API does not require authentication.

docs.title: Response Format
docs.text:
All responses are returned in JSON format:

```json { "data": { // Response data }, "status": "success", "timestamp": "2024-02-20T12:00:00Z" }

{ "error": { "code": "ERROR_CODE", "message": "Error description", "details": {} }, "status": "error", "timestamp": "2024-02-20T12:00:00Z" }

docs.title: Code Style
docs.text:
• Use Black for code formatting
  • Follow PEP 8 guidelines
  • Add type hints to all functions
  • Write docstrings for all public functions

docs.title: Pull Request Process
docs.text:
1. Create a feature branch
  2. Add tests for new functionality
  3. Ensure all tests pass
  4. Update documentation
  5. Submit PR for review

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Docker Desktop
  • Visual Studio Code
  • Dev Containers extension
  • Poetry (Python package manager)

docs.title: 1. Clone the Repository
docs.text: ```bash git clone https://github.com/szymon0f/coingecko-api-service.git cd coingecko-api-service
